subject: Re: [junit] where lives your junit stuff
msgSnippet: ... You already got some suggestions for where to install java and where to put JUnit. I can t remeber when I last run JUnit from the commandline... so... The
messageBody:
> is there no better way to run junit then with commands like
>
> $ java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore ...
>
> do you write command wrappers and how?
>
> thanks a lot for your answers


You already got some suggestions for where to install java and where
to put JUnit.

I can't remeber when I last run JUnit from the commandline... so...

The second thing I would do is to download an IDE such as eclipse
http://www.eclipse.org or netbeans http://www.netbeans.org/ that are
free and really good (haven't used netbeans in years when it was slow
and boring but I heard that it really shaped up lately so maybe it is
time to look at it again).

An IDE greatly simplifies development in more ways than I can mention,
including running tests flexibly and often.

While maven, buildr, ant or equivalent is pretty much mandatory for
packaging and releasing production quality software I would look into
that after I am comfortable enough to build and test in the IDE.

But that's just me...
Hope this helps
/J
